Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya hit a six with an on-pace ball to go offbreak and wider outside off, resulting in a catch at deep midwicket.
Tanzid Hasan dismissed Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav in the space of three balls.
Rishad Hossain's legspin was just unplayable, contributing to Bangladesh's struggles.
Pre-Game Insights: Najmul Hossain Shanto expected 150-160 to be a good score on the pitch.
Toss: Bangladesh won and elected to bowl first.
India might not even be able to play the XI they're playing today without Hardik. On the Caribbean's slow pitches, and more so in these day games, having the extra spin option is important.
Post-Match Reflections: India won by 50 runs, India's batting was fueled by a handful of batters taking risks, with Hardik Pandya scoring a fifty.
Bangladesh's brightest spot was Tanzid Hasan, who dismissed Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav in the space of three balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was fresh for this match.
Conditions will get harder for boundary-scoring as the sun beats down.
Melinda Farrell mentioned the cross breeze blowing from left to right, affecting the boundaries.

The clouds are starting to look a little darker as they scud across the sky.

Vox pop: Bangladesh fans on team's T20 World Cup chances.
